meanings.definition: In a manner that disappears or fades away completely.
meanings.sent1: The magician made the rabbit vanish vanishingly into thin air.
meanings.sent2: The sunlight faded vanishingly as the day turned to dusk.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream cone melted vanishingly fast in the hot sun.
meanings.sent4: Her hopes of winning the lottery vanished vanishingly quickly.
meanings.sent5: The sound of laughter faded vanishingly into the distance.

meanings.definition: To an extremely small or negligible degree.
meanings.sent1: She vanishingly believed in ghosts, thinking they were just stories.
meanings.sent2: The chances of finding a four-leaf clover in the field were vanishingly slim.
meanings.sent3: His interest in the subject vanished vanishingly after the first class.
meanings.sent4: The old building was vanishingly small compared to the modern skyscrapers.
meanings.sent5: The number of stars visible in the city was vanishingly few due to light pollution.
